newsitem.title: USA: ConEd sees record power demand this summer.
newsitem.headline: ConEd sees record power demand this summer.

text.p: Consolidated Edison Co of New York (ConEd) said in a statement Tuesday it expects to see record electric demand on its grid this summer.
The projected peak of 11,075 megawatts (MW) would exceed by 270 MW the previous 10,805 MW record set on August 2, 1995.
The expected surge would result mainly from the increased use of residential air conditioning and demand from some new business growth in its service territory, Con Ed said.

The company said the peak load projection is important because the ConEd system, along with the rest of New York's utilities, must have enough power available to meet the projected peak plus a reserve capacity of 18 percent.
ConEd provides electric service to three million customers in New York City and Westchester County, just north of the city. It also supplies natural gas in Manhattan.
